original_title: Sri Lankans who open tax files won’t be questioned on old income: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Individuals who open income tax accounts under a gazette notice will not be asked questions on tax returns not filed of prior years, State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said.
Sri Lanka issued a gazette requiring, doctors, lawyers and vehicle owners to open an income tax account from June 01, and anyone over 18 years from next year.
“The income tax applies to year 2022/2023,” Minister Siyambalapitiya told parliament.
“If there is no special reason we will not be asking about the past. Many people question, will we ask about the history and will it affect their wealth. Nothing like that will happen.
“We expect starting from this year, to make them participate in increasing the state revenue.”
The Department of Inland Revenue will set up a call centre shortly to answer public questions, he said.
In Sri Lanka tax returns are filed voluntarily and as long as accounts are kept accurately there is nothing to worry, he said. (Colombo/ June 08/2023)
